channel.title: Oct
channel.description: Day By Day VA Family-Literacy Calendar

item.title: October Monthly Activities
item.description:
Books to Read!

• Brush Your Teetn, Max and Millie by Felicity Brooks and Desideria Guicciardini
• I Can Be Safe: A First Look At Safety by Pat Thomas and Lesley Harker
• Achoo: Good Manners Can Be Contagious by Mij Kelly and Mary McQuillan
• Goodnight, Teddy Bear by Kimberly Bennet, Michael Yu, and Daniela Frongia Children's Books
• Good Enough To Eat: A Kid's Guide To Food and Nutrition by Lizzy Rockwell
• I Love To Sleep In My Own Bed by Shelley Admont
• Biscuit Visits the Doctor by Alyssa Satin Capucilli and Pat Schories
• Now I'm Growing!: A Visit To the Doctor by Nora Gaydos
• One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish by Dr. Seuss
• One Big Building: A Counting Book About Construction by Michael Dahl and Todd Ouren
• Counting Crocodiles by Judy Sierra and Will Hillenbrand
• We're Going On A Leaf Hunt by Steve Metzger and Miki Sakamoto
• The Fantastic Gifts of Fall by Dandi Mackall
• Animals In Fall: Preparing For Winter by Martha E. H. Rustad and Amanda Enright
• Apples and Pumpkins by Anne Rockwell and Lizzy Rockwell
• From Seed To Pumpkin by Wendy Pfeffer
• Little Boo by Stephen Wunderll and Tim Zeltner
• The Ugly Pumpkin by Dave Horowitz
• The Legend of Spookley the Square Pumpkin by Joe Troiano and Susan Banta
• Molly the Muffin Fairy by Make Believe Ideas
• Arthur's Halloween Costume by Lillian Hoban
• Bad Kitty vs Uncle Murray by Nick Bruel
• Fancy Nancy: Halloween . . . or Bust! by Jane O'Connor and Robin Preiss Glasser
• Harry and the Lady Next Door by Gene Zion and Margaret Bloy Graham
• Fox and Crow Are Not Friends by Melissa Wiley and Sebastian Braun
• Nanny Piggins and the Runaway Lion by R. A. Spratt and Dan Santat
• Just Grandpa and Me by Mercer Mayer
• The New Baby by Mercer Mayer
• Best-Ever Big Sister by Karen Katz

Artwork by Patrick Girouard iREAD 2014 Summer Reading Program

Around VA

Check out Festivals and Events happening in October around the state.

  • Fredericksburg Original Sewing and Quilt Expo - Fredericksburg
  • Chantilly Fall Gun and Knife Show - Chantilly
  • Waterford Homes Tour and Crafts Exhibits - Waterford
  • Martinsville Fall First Friday Art Walk - Martinsville
  • Montpelier Station Fiber Festival - Montpelier Station
  • Manassas Fall Jubilee - Manassas
  • Virginia Children's Festival - Norfolk
  • Wytheville Fall Farmers Market - Wytheville
  • Fishersville Fall Indoor Outdoor Market and Yard Sale - Fishersville
  • Bark In the Park - Chesapeake
  • Craftsmen's Classic Arts and Crafts Festival - Roanoke
  • Monterey Hand and Harvest Festival - Monterey
  • Richmond Folk Festival - Richmond
  • Chincoteague Oyster Festival - Chincoteague
  • Culpeper Air Fest - Brandy Station
  • Port Warwick Art and Sculpture Festival - Newport News
  • Winchester Fall Gun Show - Winchester
  • Chincoteague Island Second Saturday Artful Flea - Chincoteague Island
  • Craftmen's Fall Classic Arts and Crafts Festival - Chantilly
  • Stafford County Fair - Stafford
  • Fredericksburg Fall Arts and Crafts Festival - Fredericksburg
  • Stockley Gardens Fall Arts Festival - Norfolk
  • Holly Point Art and Seafood Festival - Deltaville
  • Town Point Wine Festival - Norfolk
  • Harrisonburg Bead, Gem, Mineral, and Jewelry Show - Harrisonburg
  • Doswell Fall Gun Show - Doswell
  • Big Island Chili Cook-Off - Big Island
  • Craftsmen's Christmas Classic Arts and Crafts Festival - Richmond
  • Salem Gun and Knife Show - Salem
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 31
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Garden

One, two, three,
The garden is growing.
Four, five, six,
Now it needs hoeing.
Seven, eight, nine,
Down go the weeds.
Ten, eleven, twelve,
Water it needs.
Thirteen, fourteen,
Here comes a shower.
Fifteen, sixteen,
A carrot and a flower!

TumbleBooks

Ogre Fun - Loris Lesynski

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Find shapes today! Can your child find something in the house that is round, a square, or a triangle?

Watch

The Paper Boy

Explore More

  • Colors and Shapes - What color and shape do you like best?
  • The Shapes Coloring Book - Print out the pages and staple for a great coloring book with shapes.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 30
item.description:
Squirrels

Five little squirrels sitting in a tree.
The first one said, "What do I see?"
The second one said, "Some nuts on the ground."
The third one said, "Those nuts I found."
The fourth one said, "I'll race you there."
The Fifth one said, "All right, that's fair."
So they shook their tails and ran with glee.
To the nuts that lay at the foot of the tree.

TumbleBooks

Only A Witch Can Fly - Alison McGhee

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Take a walk and count acorns.

Watch

Monster Me

Explore More

  • Foot Ghost - Make a spooky art piece using your feet!
  • What’s In the Bag? - Can you tell what is in the bag?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 29
item.description:
Sing a Song

One Potato, Two Potato

One potato, two potato,
Three potato, four,
Five potato, six potato,
Seven potato, more!

Watch

Quarterrific

Try This

Go outside and play hopscotch. Another fun outdoor activity is number dash. Write numbers on the pavement. Then yell out a number and have everyone run to that number!

TumbleBooks

When Pigasso Met Mootisse - Nina Laden

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Tangram Puzzle - What can you make with the shapes?
  • The Tale of Mr. Jeremy Fisher - Read and listen along to this story by the same author as The Tale of Peter Rabbit.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 28
item.description:
Sing a Song

Pea Soup

One little pea,
Jumped into the pot,
And waited for the soup to get hot.
(Tuck thumb into fist)

Two little peas jumped into the pot,
And waited for the soup to get hot.
(Tuck pointer finger into fist)

Three little peas jumped into the pot,
And waited for the soup to get hot.
(Tuck middle finger into fist)

Four little peas jumped into the pot,
And waited for the soup to get hot.
(Tuck little finger into fist)

Finally the soup got so very hot,
All the little peas jumped out of the pot!
(Open hand and wiggle all your fingers)

Watch

Just the Juice, Jack

Try This

Help your child count the number of seeds in a pumpkin or an apple.

TumbleBooks

A Camping Spree with Mr Magee - Chris Van Dusen

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • How Many - Pick the correct number of seeds and watch the flowers grow!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 27
item.description:
Sing a Song

Once I Saw an Ant Hill

Once I saw an anthill
(make a fist with thumb in)
With no ants about;
So I said, "Dear little ants
(put fist near mouth)
Won't you please come out?"
Then as if the little ants
Had heard my little shout,
One, two, three, four, five
(open up fist one finger at a time)
They all came out.

Watch

Counting for Pleasure

Try This

Bring a set of measuring cups or spoons into the bathtub for your child. Practice counting and measuring.

TumbleBooks

Beautiful Moon - Dawn Jeffers

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Seek and Find - Can you find the items in the picture?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 26
item.description:
My Birthday Cake

My birthday cake is pink and white
(Make round circle with arms)
Lighted candles make it bright.
1,2,3,4,5 pink candles
(Hold up fingers)
What a pretty sight.
(Wiggle fingers)

TumbleBooks

Wait and See - Robert Munsch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Talk about birthdays. Point out your child's birthday and those of other family members on a calendar. Talk about the ages of your family members.

Watch

Strega Nona

Explore More

  • Juice Box Dolls - Everyone in the family can make a juice box doll decorated as family members, animals, or a just plain wacky doll!
  • Sandwich Box Monster - Turn an empty box into a not-so-scary monster friend.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 25
item.description:
The Grand Old Duke of York

The Grand Old Duke of York he had ten thousand men
He marched them up to the top of the hill
And he marched them down again.
When they were up, they were up
And when they were down, they were down
And when they were only halfway up
They were neither up nor down.

Watch

Dollars and Sense

Try This

Play I Spy with numbers.

TumbleBooks

Ace Lacewing: Bad Bugs Are My Business - David Biedrzycki

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Count on It - Use the money to buy a slice of pizza, banana, and more!
  • Eye Spy Adventures - Play Eye Spy along with the video, then make your own game with things around the house.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 24
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five Little Fishies

Five little fishies swimming in a pool,
(wiggle fingers)
First one said, "The pool is cool."
(one finger up, wrap arms around body)
Second one said, "The pool is deep."
(two fingers up, measure deep)
Third one said, "I want to sleep."
(three fingers up, rest head on hands)
Fourth one said, "Let's dive and dip."
(four fingers up, hand dives and dips)
Fifth one said, "I spy a ship."
(five fingers up, peer out under hand)
Fisherman's boat comes,
(fingers form a V and move away from body)
Line goes ker-splash,
(pantomime throwing fishing line)
Away the five little fishies dash.
(wiggle five fingers away)

TumbleBooks

Tyson the Terrible - Diane and Christyan Fox

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Singing day! Together, sing songs with numbers: The Ants Go Marching, Five Little Ducks, and One Potato, Two Potato.

Watch

How Many Kisses Do You Want Tonight?

Explore More

  • Four in a Line - Try to get four of your color in a line!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 23
item.description:
Sing a Song

Hot Cross Buns

Hot cross buns!
Hot cross buns!
One a penny,
Two a penny,
Hot cross buns!

Watch

Dime and Dime Again

Try This

Show your child how to measure a cup, half cup, and quarter cup of water with a measuring cup. Use salt dough to make numbers.

TumbleBooks

The Best Excuse - Ellen Feinman Moss

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Slime Time - Make slime in a couple of different colors and count the slime blobs today!
  • Just for Kids - The recipe for slime and other fun activities are available here.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 22
item.description:
This Old Man

Sing This Old Man all the way up to ten. Do the hand motions or make up your own!

This old man, he played one,
He played knick-knack on my thumb;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

This old man, he played two,
He played knick-knack on my shoe;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

This old man, he played three,
He played knick-knack on my knee;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

This old man, he played four,
He played knick-knack on my door;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

This old man, he played five,
He played knick-knack on my hive;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

This old man, he played six,
He played knick-knack on my sticks;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

This old man, he played seven,
He played knick-knack up in Heaven;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

This old man, he played eight,
He played knick-knack on my gate;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

This old man, he played nine,
He played knick-knack on my spine;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

This old man, he played ten,
He played knick-knack once again;
Knick-knack paddywhack,
Give a dog a bone,
This old man came rolling home.

Watch

Five Fingers

Try This

Help your child learn their phone number and address. You can make up a song together for practice!

TumbleBooks

Dad Runs Away With the Circus - Edgar Keret

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Learning Your Address and Phone Number - Here are ideas for having fun while learning important information.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 21
item.description:
Ten In A Bed

There were ten in a bed and the little one said, "Roll over, roll over."
(rolling motion)
So they all rolled over and one fell out.
There were nine in the bed and the little one said, "Roll over, roll over."
So they all rolled over and one fell out....
(repeat until you get to one)
There was one in the bed and the little one said, "Good night!"

Watch

Three is a Magic Number

Try This

Play Which is bigger? or What comes next? using numbers 1 to 10.

TumbleBooks

Big Or Little - Kathy Stinson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Which is Bigger? - Can you choose which train car is bigger?
  • More Less - Feed the monster the bug with more or less legs and watch him grow!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 20
item.description:
Five Cookies

Five little cookies in the bakery shop.
Shining bright with the sugar on top.
Along comes (child's name) with a nickel to pay.
He/she buys a cookie and takes it away.
(continue with four, three, two and one)

Watch

Nature Numbers

Try This

Talk about how much a penny, nickel, dime, and quarter are worth and how many of each are in a dollar.

TumbleBooks

You Think It's Easy Being the Tooth Fairy? - Sheri Bell-Rehwoldt

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Painting Quarters - How would you paint the South Carolina quarter?
  • Painter’s Studio - Here are some other quarters to color.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 19
item.description:
Sing a Song

1 Little, 2 Little, 3 Little…

Traditionally this song has been about Indians. However, for a modern version, try substituting Puppies, Cows, Trains, and anything else you and your child can think of!

1 little 2 little 3 little Indians
4 little 5 little 6 little Indians
7 little 8 little 9 little Indians
10 little Indians go (make a sound)
10 little 9 little 8 little Indians
7 little 6 little 5 little Indians
4 little 3 little 2 little Indians
1 little Indian goes (make a sound)

Watch

Counting Song

Try This

Spend time during the day counting doors and windows.

TumbleBooks

Doors - Roxie Monro

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • What’s in the Mystery Box - Make your own mystery box and guess what is placed inside.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 18
item.description:
Red Hen Red Hen

Tune: Baa Baa Black Sheep

Red hen, red hen, have you eggs from me?
Yes, sir. Yes, sir. A lot you see.
One to hard boil.
Another one to fry.
One to scramble.
And Easter eggs to dye.
Red Hen, red hen, have you eggs for me?
Yes, sir. Yes, sir A whole lot you see.

Watch

Special Name for 12

Try This

Explain what a dozen means. Count the number of eggs in a carton. Save the empty carton for future projects.

TumbleBooks

Louise, The Adventures of a Chicken - Kate Di Camillo

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Egg Carton Animal Nose Mask - Make a nose for everyone in the family!
  • Egg Carton Eyes Headband. - Decorate the eyes and wear above your head.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 17
item.description:
What I Can Do?

I can spin just like a top.
Look at me! Look at me!
I have feet and I can hop.
Look at me! Look at me!
I have hands and I can clap.
Look at me! Look at me!
I can lay then in my lap.
Look at me! Look at me.

TumbleBooks

Tops and Bottoms - Janet Stevens

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Take a walk together. Talk about animals with two legs and with four legs.

Watch

Doctor DeSoto

Explore More

  • Wishing Well - Put in a quarter and ask a question. The wishing well will let you know your future!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 16
item.description:
Sing a Song

This Little Piggy

This little piggy went to market,
This little piggy stayed at home,
This little piggy had roast beef,
This little piggy had none.
And this little piggy went
"Wee wee wee" all the way home.

Watch

Five Green Peas

Try This

Help your child count his or her fingers and toes. Use the Mother Goose rhyme This Little Piggy with your child's toes.

TumbleBooks

Animals Black And White - Phyllis Limbacher Tildes

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Interactive 100 Number Chart - You can color numbers online, all the way up to 100!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 15
item.description:
Sing a Song

Lonely Bus Driver

One lonely bus driver all alone and blue
He picked up a passenger and then there were two.
Two people riding, they stopped by a tree
They picked up a passenger, and then there were three.
Three people riding, they stopped by a store
They picked up a passenger, and then there were four.
Four people riding, happy and alive,
They picked up a passenger, and then there were five.
Five people riding open swung the door
Four passengers got off the bus,
The driver's alone once more.

TumbleBooks

Me Too! - Jamie Harper

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Hve your child draw a picture of the family members who live with you. Then practice counting the people forward and backward.

Watch

24 Bottles of Pop

Explore More

  • Family Tree of Hands - Everyone in the family can have a “hand” in making this family tree.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 14
item.description:
Sing a Song

One, Two, Tie My Shoe

1,2 Tie my shoe
3,4 Shut the door
5,6 Pick up sticks
7,8 Lay them straight
9, 10 A big fat hen.
Let's get up and count again!

One, Two, Buckle My Shoe

One, two,
Buckle my shoe
Three, four,
Shut the door
Five, six,
Pick up sticks
Seven eight,
Lay them straight
Nine, ten,
Do it again!

Watch

One, Two Buckle My Shoe

Try This

Exercise with your child by hopping or doing jumping jacks. Count as you go.

TumbleBooks

One Odd Day - Doris Fisher and Dani Sneed

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Let’s Move - Here are great ideas for keeping healthy-like doing jumping jacks while watching TV.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 13
item.description:
Sing a Song

Diez Deditos

Unos, dos, tres deditos
Cuatro, cinco, seis deditos
Siete, ocho, nueve deditos
Y uno más son diez.

Watch

Numbers Song in Spanish

Try This

Count from 1 to 10 in English and Spanish with your child. Sing Diez Deditos (10 little fingers).

TumbleBooks

Boomer Goes to School - Constance McGeorge

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • English-Spanish Numbers - Find out how to pronounce the numbers in Spanish.
  • Spanish Number Dominoes - You can print out and decorate these dominoes in Spanish!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 12
item.description:
Sing a Song

Ball

(Shape hands to make a ball)
A little ball,
A bigger ball,
A great big ball I see.

Now let us count
The balls we've made,
One, two, three.
(Point with one hand to count)

Watch

Days of the Month

Try This

Have your child find all of the numbers on a box such as a cereal box.

TumbleBooks

Lost and Found, Story 1: Molly - Jim LaMarche

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Meddybemps Animal Count - Count the animals in each picture!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 11
item.description:
Sing a Song

Good Morning Song

Oh, the duck says "Quack",
and the cow says "Moo",
the old red rooster says
"Cock-a-doodle-doo".
The sheep says "Baa",
and the cat says "Meow",
but I say "Good Morning
when I see you!

Watch

Bumposaurus

Try This

Show your child what time it is during the morning, afternoon, evening, and bedtime. Talk about some of the routines you have at those times of day.

TumbleBooks

Little Oink - Amy Krouse Rosenthal

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Charts for Daily Routines - Print or make a chart with your daily routines to learn more about time of day and staying organized!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 10
item.description:
Sing a Song

One Little Flower, One Little Bee

One little flower, one little bee.
One little blue bird, high in the tree.
One little brown bear smiling at me.
One is the number I like, you see.

TumbleBooks

One is a Drummer: A Book of Numbers - Roseanne Thong

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Have a number snack! Count a snack such as pretzels, goldfish crackers, grapes, or other small countable food.

Watch

One Little, Two Little, Three Little Children

Explore More

  • Matisse Pieces - Choose the shapes you want for your art, color, and print.
  • A Counting Game - Can you count the number of bunnies in each window?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 9
item.description:
Five Fish

One, two, three, four, five,
Once I caught a fish alive;
Six, seven, eight, nine, ten,
Then I let him go again.
Why did you let him go?
Because he bit my finger so!
Which finger did he bite?
This little finger on the right!

TumbleBooks

Dinosaurs Roar, Butterflies Soar! - Bob Barner

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Visit the library! Find a Shel Silverstein book and a copy of Wheels on the Bus to read and sing together. Also check out The Little Elephant with the Big Earache by Charlotte Cowan M.D.

Watch

Ten Little Airplanes

Explore More

  • School Bus Carton Craft - Recycle a used egg carton to make a school bus craft.
  • Playset Universe - You can add cars, plants, ships, and even dinosaurs to your very own play world. What will you add?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 8
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five little monkeys jumping on the bed
(bounce fingers on opposite palm)
One fell off and bumped his (or her) head
(tap head)
Mama called the doctor and the doctor said...
(pretend to talk on the phone)
"No more monkeys jumping on the bed!"
(shake index finger)

TumbleBooks

The Paper Crane - Molly Bang

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Look for the number 5 today. Sing 5 Little Monkeys Jumping on the Bed.

Watch

Ten Green Bottles

Explore More

  • StoryPlace Presents Monkeys - Read an online story, play a game, and do an activity all about monkeys!
  • Monkey Moves - Do a monkey move or two with Curious George.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 7
item.description:
Sing a Song

Three Little Nickels

Three little nickels in a pocketbook new,
(hold up three fingers)
One bought a peppermint, and then there were two,
(bend down one finger)
Two little nickels before the day was done,
One bought an ice cream come, and then there was one
(bend down another finger)
One little nickel I heard it plainly say,
"I'm going into the piggy bank for a rainy day!"

Watch

Value of a Dollar

Try This

Help your child sort coins into groups by size. Talk about size and which coin is bigger.

TumbleBooks

Pet Peeves - Sarah Willson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Polishing Pennies - Did you know that lemon juice can brighten up old pennies? Try it today!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 6
item.description:
Sing a Song

Hickory Dickory Dock

Hickory, dickory, dock!
(tick tock)
The mouse ran up the clock;
(tick tock)
The clock struck one,
The mouse ran down,
Hickory, dickory, dock!
(tick tock)

TumbleBooks

I.Q., It's Time - Mary Ann Fraser

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Show your child a clock with a face and count the hours. Explain the number of hours in a day. Talk about how the number 12 can mean noon and midnight.

Watch

Hickory Dickory Dock

Explore More

  • Clock - This huge clock can tell you what time it is now and you can adjust it for whatever time you want.
  • Clock Game - Can you pick the clocks with the correct time?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 5
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five Pennies

5 little pennies under my bed.
One rolled on the floor
And then there were 4 little pennies over by the tree,
A frog came and got one and now there were three.
Three little pennies under my shoe
Along came an ant and now there are two.
Two little pennies laying under the sun,
Soon came a caterpillar
Who put it on his back and then there was one.
One little penny who was all alone,
Rolled along until he found his home.

TumbleBooks

All Aboard The Dinotrain - Deb Lund

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Count by fives and tens as high as your child can go.

Watch

Sesame Street: Counting Bayou Fives

Explore More

  • Number Game - Pick a number and make the balls dance.
  • Space Race - Play the Space Race game and be the first to race to the finish line!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 4
item.description:
Sing a Song

Pairs

Two things make a pair.
(Hold up two fingers.)
And on me, I’ll show you where.
(Point to self.)
I have two ears, and I have two eyes.
(Point to ear and eyes.)
Both are important to make me wise!
I have two holes in my nose.
(Point to nose.)
That lets me smell a beautiful rose.
(Pretend to smell a rose.)
I have two hands that clap a beat.
(Clap hands to underlined words.)
I have two feet that are really neat!
(Jump when saying the word neat!)

Watch

Bet You Can’t

Try This

Today, you and your child count the socks in your house, singly and in pairs. Talk about things that come in pairs.

TumbleBooks

My Even Day - Doris Fisher and Dani Sneed

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Polar Pairs - Can you find the matching animals?
  • Butterfly Matching - Match the butterfly wings that are the same and watch the butterfly fly away!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 3
item.description:
Sing a Song

One Finger, One Thumb

One finger, one thumb keep moving.
One finger, one thumb keep moving.
We all stay merry and bright.

One finger, one thumb, one arm, keep moving.
One finger, one thumb, one arm, keep moving.
We all stay merry and bright.

One finger, one thumb, one arm, one leg, keep moving.
One finger, one thumb, one arm, one leg, keep moving.
We all stay merry and bright.
One finger, one thumb, one arm, one leg, stand up sit down, keep moving.
One finger, one thumb, one arm, one leg, stand up sit down, keep moving.
We all stay merry and bright.

TumbleBooks

The Boy in the Drawer - Robert Munsch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

How tall are you? With your child, measure each member of your family at the beginning of the month and again at the end. Did they grow?

Watch

Poppy & Max

Explore More

  • How Tall - Can you help Curious George measure things?
  • Gizma’s Robot Builder - Make your very own robot!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 2
item.description:
Sing a Song

One, Two, Three, Four, Five

One, two, three, four, five.
Once I caught a fish alive,
Six, seven, eight, nine, ten,
Then I let it go again.
Why did you let it go?
Because it bit my finger so.
Which finger did it bite?
This little finger on the right.

Watch

Ten Tiny Turtles

Try This

Talk about the 5 levels of the food pyramid (grains, fruits, vegetables, dairy, and meat). Count fruits or vegetables at mealtimes.

TumbleBooks

Little Pea - Amy Krause Rosenthal

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Food Guide Pyramid - You can listen to this article about the new Food Pyramid. What kinds of foods should you eat everyday!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: October 1
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five Little Ladybugs

Five little ladybugs on our front door, (Hold up five fingers.)
One flew to Isaac, and that left four. (Hold up four fingers.)
Four little ladybugs, oh so wee,
One flew to Dad, and that left three. (Hold up three fingers.)
Three little ladybugs saying "howdy-do,"
One flew to Brian, and that left two. (Hold up two fingers.)
Two little ladybugs snoozing in the sun,
One flew to Sarah, and that left one. (Hold up one finger.)
One little ladybug alone on the door,
It flew to Mom, then there were no more.
(Bend down last finger.)

Substitute names of people in your family for those in the rhyme.

Watch

I have 10 Little Fingers

Try This

Help your child write out the numbers from 1 to 10. Use this sheet throughout the month to practice counting.

TumbleBooks

One Duck Stuck - Phyllis Root

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Tic Tac Toe - Play tic tac toe and see if you can beat the computer.
  • Rosita’s Fiesta - Help Rosita pass out the food to all her friends!
